website_summaries.verdict: A big backpack that can also be carried as a duffel, thanks to extra carrying straps.
pros: This heavy duty mesh bag has a nice touch – solid PVC on the side where you carry it so you don’t get wet from soggy gear
It also comes with drain holes on the bottom of the main compartment as well as on the the outside pouch, making it excellent for drying out gear

customer_reviews.title: Totally Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is obviously high quality and very well put together. I inspected it for sewing, seems, pockets, zippers, etc. Everything works perfectly and looks/feels rugged. The two carry handles and backpack straps provide plenty of carry options. Folds very flat for travel. Easily fit all my gear; fins, boots, mask, wet suit, towel, swim suit, snorkel, weights, etc. I highly recommend this for a good quality, fairly priced piece of gear and from it's competitors, I really, really like the larger side zipper compartment that holds more accessories, etc, than the other competitors flat pocket zipper compartment. I highly recommend this quality, versatile bag for all your dive or beach gear!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Bill B

customer_reviews.title: As expected, good bag, but not as easy to load as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: This type of bag is great for wet gear, very sturdy, holds plenty, and I like the back pack style so you can distribute the weight on both shoulders, but it's not as easy to load from the top as a duffle bag style unless you have a second person to hold it open for you. Not a big deal, but something to consider. Over all it's a very good bag. If you plan to travel a lot I'd get something with wheels instead, however, because there's no way to make dive gear light if you're hauling on the cruise ship or through the airport. Also it's probably not secure enough to be a "checked bag."
customer_reviews.author: AJHammer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my warm water kit
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with how sturdy this bag is and how well everything in my warm water kit fits in it. The handle on the top is very rugged and I don't expect it to ever fail. The only minor tweak I would wish for is to have the shoulder straps shorter so the adjustment buckle is higher up to grab. With the current setup, the adjustment buckle ends up right behind my love handles and isn't the easiest to get to while I'm wearing the bag like a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Long

customer_reviews.title: What a fabulous bag.
customer_reviews.text: Rough and tough construction- regulator bag that is attached appears too small for a modern octopus style rig. Overall though I am delighted with the size ( maybe the size is too generous?) and the back pack style for trekking all the way from the hotel room to the beach and boat. Just looks and feels heavy duty - I love it.
customer_reviews.author: DTee

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag !!
customer_reviews.text: Really a great dive bag - very well made with reinforced seams and fabric. Great for vacation dive trips when you don't want to lug the really big bags around. My wife has EVO's equivalent, and there is no comparison in quality. The Mares is cheaper in price and better in build. I especially like this bag since most bags like this are made for small gear, but being a 6'2" guy who wears XL or XXL in everything, there is plenty of room for all my dive gear.
customer_reviews.author: Sharker

customer_reviews.title: This a great bag. Fits all of my gear (BC
customer_reviews.text: This a great bag. Fits all of my gear (BC, weights, regulator, fins, mask, dive book, towel and more). Has the front pocket with enough space to fit a mask in its hard case and it also has a pocket on the inside for storing smaller stuff like a dive book. The best part is the side zipper which makes it possible to access everything without having to take everything out. Only problem I had was that the stitching on one of the bag pack straps started coming apart. After sewing it though it was like new.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Bag
customer_reviews.text: I just got back from my first dive vacation with this bag and absolutely love it. I easily packed my BCD, wetsuit, regulator, fins, booties, mask, log book and a towel inside, and kept a dry bag with cash and ID, along with hair ties, Dramamine, a Go Pro and a save a dive kit in the outside pocket. It could have held more. I then swung it over my shoulder and walked through my resort and into a cab to the dive shop with ease. I guess I'll have to see how it stands up to multiple dive vacations, but as of now, I couldn't recommend it more highly.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised!  Outside pocket not padded, will not protect regulator or dive computer.  :(
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed to receive this bag and see that the outside pocket is not padded!!!! The advertisement says that it's padded to protect your regulator and computer, but it's not even a little padded. It's a single sheet of nylon. I was really looking forward to having a padded regulator pocket on the outside of my dive bag... and the reviews were all so good, I was surprised this wasn't mentioned by anyone. I double checked the tag to see if I was sent the wrong product - it's not. Even the nice embroidery on the pocket reads "Cruise Mesh Deluxe."
customer_reviews.author: nacirema

customer_reviews.title: Great for Watersports - lots of room
customer_reviews.text: I got this to carry my water ski equipment in. Was looking for something that I could load with wet gear, throw in the boat or bed of the truck, and not worry about it instantly starting to mildew. The mesh is great. Sturdy enough to keep everything in, but still allows for ample air flow and drainage. I'm able to fit 2 wet suits, 4 ropes, 2 life vest, a couple towels, a soft side cooler, and a helmet in no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy mesh backpack with tough bottom.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with 3 of them for our dive family. We load with all our gear included our integrated weights so really putting it to the test. Top draw string struggles a little to stay closed with all the weight but has a good side zipper for another way to access and close it. Handles have all held up to the weight well so far. Overall sturdy. Pleased.
customer_reviews.author: snippit

customer_reviews.title: Easy in-out use, and keeps all the gear contained
customer_reviews.text: Keep all my dive gear contained (minus tank of course) and made it easy to carry while getting to and on the dive boat. Easily held fins, BCD/regs, mask/snorkel w/case in the main mesh compartment. Small front pouch had plenty of room for dive CPU, flashlight, personal effects, etc. Mesh is durable and almost coated with a stiffening material. Don't know, but it held up to a lot of use already and saltwater... so for what its worth, it works and still works for me.
customer_reviews.author: AFWxman

customer_reviews.title: Very roomy
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from my cruise and this back pack was a life saver. This made it super easy to carry my gear aboard. Its very roomy, and seems to be pretty strong. You could get 2 sets of gear in one pack if you had thin wet suits. I did not carry my weights (24 lbs) in it, although I did test it with my weights. with all my gear and It did not rip right away, but it was really uncomfortable. I suggest using a separate bag for your weights.
customer_reviews.author: Big W

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable bag, fragile base
customer_reviews.text: Solid bag with comfy wide straps for your shoulders (important when carrying heavy loads). The plastic mesh holds up very well, though the same cannot be said for the bottom which is built of heavy duty canvas. I've had the bag for about two months and there are already small holes forming. My friend has the same bag for a year and the bottom of his is almost entirely comprised of duct tape. However, I'm pretty rough with my gear. As long as you don't drag the bag on the bottom of the boat/ground it should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Useful piece of gear
customer_reviews.text: holds my fins, boots, mask-box, bcd in the main pocket easily, with enough room for a towel and dive skin. side pocket is roomy enough to hold my regulator (1st, 2nd, octo, hoses, gauge console) flat pocket along the back is nice for documentation and small parts, but isn't waterproof so don't put paper things in there. straps are reasonably cushy but i find myself using the side handle more (balances nicely if you have a full tank in the other hand!) top drawstring isn't terribly secure; be aware you might want to knot it if you are walking further than dock->boat.
customer_reviews.author: W. W. Ewin

customer_reviews.title: High quality snorkel bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag! I bought a slightly less expensive bag and broke a strap heading out on my second trip. This bag is much heavier but appears to be vastly superior quality. Shoulder straps are well secured and the mesh appears to be durable. I have only used it on one trip, but I have no concerns going forward. Its a large bag! I can easily get two sets of snorkels, fins, masks, etc. and still get it in the carry on overhead bins on airplanes. I think this bag is un-beatable for the price!! I would definitely recommend it, and highly doubt I will be buying another anytime soon!
customer_reviews.author: 67bmer

customer_reviews.title: Far better (and bigger) than I was expecting!
customer_reviews.text: When this first arrived I was bit taken aback because it's larger than I was expecting. I soon got over that, though, when I realized that it's an excellent size for my gear. This is a VERY HIGH QUALITY PRODUCT! I was extremely pleased in that respect. It has multiple straps and handles for carrying it in different ways, a top drawstring and a side zipper option for getting inside it, and two water-resistant pouches (one inside and one out) for carrying stuff that you need to keep dry. I really can't say enough good things about this bag. The design and manufacture are both exceptionally impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Chief Cynic In Charge

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the price.
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome bag, I was able to get two sets of fins, dive boots, wet suit, two mask, BCD, camera, regulators, snorkels, and a few other things in this bag and still had room. The side pouch is not water proof but makes a great compartment for your dive computers, anti fog spray, tools, extra reg parts, etc. Is a pretty big pocket. I bought this due to going diving on a cruise and wanted a back pack for the ease of walking long distances. It was pretty heavy especially when everything was wet but it's construction held up without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Hubcap

customer_reviews.title: Shoulder strap problem
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag for two trips. The first 5 days of boat diving it worked well. The second trip of boat dives the shoulder strap and hand strap at the top ripped out of the seam. I will take it to a shoe repair shop instead of messing with a return. Also, it did not come with the rope/tie for the top. Eight dollars for thick rope to tie it closed. I do not recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: CBHaze

customer_reviews.title: You'll be glad you got this bag.
customer_reviews.text: What a great bag! Heavy duty mesh will last a long time. Easy access side zipper when the draw string top is pulled tight. Nice padded straps and a nice attached zippered bag for storing personal items. Keep your save-a-dive kit, sunscreen, sun glasses, etc. Carry everything to the boat in this bag. At the bottom of the bag is a grommet hole for water to drain out. You'll love this bag for its function and for its price. Comes in a good sized box but folds small enough to fit in your luggage. It will hold your BCD, wetsuit, snorkel, mask, fins, towel, change of clothes, it's huge!
customer_reviews.author: King Lamoni

customer_reviews.title: Good materials, holds a ton of dive gear
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Good materials, holds a ton of dive gear. CONS: Does not take any developments of modern backpacks into account. Its a great bag, and a lousy backpack. So if you fill it up its really hard to carry. To the manufacturer, add a few things and this would be great: A standard padded waist strap to put weight on the hips rather than the shoulders. A strap the goes around the outside of the bad to "squeeze" the contents of the bad closer to your back. Basically - look at any backpacking pack and use at least a few of the ideas.
customer_reviews.author: David Seeman

customer_reviews.title: My buddy likes the bag
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my buddy's bag due to someone walking off with it. This bag is full-sized. It is well made. The slightly rubbery feel of the mesh is nice. It has good seams. The outside pocket is generous. Note: There is no "dry pocket" in this bag. There is an inside section which is not dry, and the outside pocket is definitely not dry. It's neither good nor bad. Just something to notice. The bag is a really good value.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: One of the best bags out there. I use it to carry my wife's fins booties and snorkels with my gear as well. It holds two sets of gear. I wanted the back pack design. Smart bag at a smart price☼ . This way my wife can a light bag with towels, our masks and her lycra suit.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Well made, holds all my gear with room for more
customer_reviews.text: This bag is well made, good quality zipper and mesh. It has a nice full-length zipper along the side to allow you to get to gear without having to take everything out from the top. The side pouch is certainly a nice accessory. Overall, I think this is a great bag for your dive gear.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is as light weight as it gets for a scuba bag and fits two sets of scuba fins, two sets of snorkeling fins, two masks, two sets of scuba boots, and extras like towels. The front pouch is great for scuba socks and other things you need to reach easily like your glasses. The mesh is made of really sturdy plasticky rubbery type material, not flimsy mesh so it holds up really well even with all the weight.
customer_reviews.author: starbella

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag!  Room for two sets.
customer_reviews.text: I recently picked up diving, so I am not familiar with diving "stuff". I purchased this bag in order to transport my fins (Cressi Frog Plus Open Heel Scuba Diving Fins), shoes, mask/goggles, and snorkel. It turns out I can fit TWO sets of all this stuff and still have room left over for towels. I can fit the two goggles [with cases] in the outer pocket. This bag is perfect for local travel; however, would not recommend for flying. It is extremely comfortable-can be carried as a backpack. I have only used this twice, so a follow-up review may be in order at a later point.
customer_reviews.author: fyl

customer_reviews.title: Best Snorkel/Diving/Beach Bag Ever for Gear!
customer_reviews.text: Took bag to Maui and it exceeded my expectations. Love the thicker mesh, and side pocket for valuables. A lot bigger than it looks online. Packed it with pro level fins, snorkel, mask and underwater Canon camera setup and towel, and hiked a few miles along West Maui to various spots for all day adventure. Even bought one each for my family members after the trip. Best ever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Dive Bag
customer_reviews.text: Works well for intended use. Everything I had fit into bad when traveling to Belize for a scuba trip. I carried all my own equipment. All fit well inside bag. My only gripe would be that the drawstring comes loose or opens on it's own. I had to tie mine up to stay closed securely. It needs another type of fastener to lock closed as the simple lock for the draw string was poor and doesn't work well. Still, I like the bad and would recommend, just have to tie the drawstring.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dale A. Stagg

customer_reviews.title: Great Mesh Bag
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mesh bag that is comfortable to put on your back while carrying gear. I recently used it for a day of scuba diving and the bag performed nicely. I really like the side zipper that runs down the length of the bag - makes getting stuff further down in the bag easier to get to.
customer_reviews.author: Van Hollywood

customer_reviews.title: Great for hauling all the family's snorkel gear!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for hauling our family of 4's snorkel gear (4 pairs of fins, 4 masks, 4 snorkels, and booties) to the beach. It is great - easy to carry, comfortable handles, has a pocket for accessories (keys, wallet, antifog goo, etc). I don't know what to use the "Cruise" thing for - it seems like another little pouch/bag. The bag itself is very sturdy - I had no issues or worries just stuffing our junk into it. I would totally buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Strictify

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This feels larger than the duffle bag option but that's not a bad thing. I think with the duffle bag option you can just dunk all your gear in fresh water after a dive whereas with his bag the outer pocket doesn't drain all that well and so I don't think it's a good idea but all in all it is great to transport gear while allowing what's inside to dry out.
customer_reviews.author: F_2

customer_reviews.title: Great dive bag
customer_reviews.text: We drug this all over the South Pacific and it worked out great as a dive bag. Of course I put it inside a carrying bag for airplane trips.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Buy this bag! Best dive gear bag ever!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down best dive gear bag in the market. This bag fits all the blue water gear, dive gear and wetsuits for two people. If I had my way I would add fin holders on the sides that can accommodate long dive find....
customer_reviews.author: Malanahae Dive Club

customer_reviews.title: nice rugged bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty boat bag, ordered this for a friend, he is very pleased, nice regulator pouch, heavy duty mesh side wall, shoulder straps and draw string. Plenty of room for all your stuff for the boat not to exclude 8 mil wetsuit with gloves and hood. I can say that once my gym bag style boat bag wears out I'll buy one of these. I see no reason why this thing won't last years. He's pleased, I'm impressed, so yes I certainly would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Justin C.

customer_reviews.title: Tougher than it looks
customer_reviews.text: Rugged, well designed dive gear bag. I still use a weight belt and like to carry my own. This bag is strong enough and big enough to carry a 12 pound belt plus my bc and other gear. The outside pocket is where I store my crushproof waterproof box for wallet, keys, glasses, phone. The shoulder straps and carry handle make it easy to lift and hang the bag on the walk to the dive boat. The mesh fabric dries quickly after the dive. Excellent product and hope it holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Keys Jack

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, fits all my scuba gear including long fins. Backpack straps are a big plus. The small external pouch is not waterproof, so you may want to use a small dry bag or Ziploc for things that can't get wet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs a better drawstring barrel lock
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. Very durable. Plenty of room for everything. Internal and external pockets are great for organization. The only downside is the barrel lock for the drawstring does not work. As soon as you pick up the bag with any small load in it the drawstring will loosen.
customer_reviews.author: keystoneclimber

customer_reviews.title: Try something else.
customer_reviews.text: It ripped during my first travel, granted that it was a rugged trip, but I didn't expect a rip from it's maiden voyage.. It's not a huge rip, but a rip none the less. I will keep monitoring that rip and hopefully not creep up and ruin the whole bag. It is comfortable to carry and move around, but I'd consider another product if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: Beco G.

customer_reviews.title: Bag held up great, and easily carried everything we needed
customer_reviews.text: Used to carry two sets of fins, masks, and snorkels as well as dive logs, towels, and change of clothes during resort diving in Jamaica. Bag held up great, and easily carried everything we needed. However, the shoulder straps are too narrow at the top, causing them to ride on my neck. Not a big deal for the 5-10 minute walks between the room and the boat, but I also used this as my carry-on bag for the flights. During extended carry periods (lines for getting on board, long hauls through connecting airports, etc...), the straps pulling on my neck got to be quite uncomfortable. The addition of a waist strap might alleviate this.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Jones

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Ok..so I FINALLY got rid of the 1985 Oceanic backpack with double pouches, side compartments for zippers and LOTS of space. I was very hesitatant because I often carry both my gear as well as my 12 year old sons gear (minus fins/mask/booties..he has a mesh bag) in my bag as well. I can say that I can COMFORTABLY fit 2 sets of fins (I always carry a backup pair in case)...my BC..mask...first aid kit....easily. He may have to carry his BC (save whats left of my back) and my weight belt but this bag gets 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Angry Appraiser

customer_reviews.title: which is nice so my soaked towel can take a ride at ...
customer_reviews.text: For a bag less than 40$... this thing is MEGA worth it! 1) side zipper 2) reinforced heavy duty design 3) even the zipper handle has cushion/reinforcement 4) mesh is heavy duty rubber or plastic. It carries a complete dive gear set with room to spare .... which is nice so my soaked towel can take a ride at the tail end of gear washing. Caveat: only four dives into this bag. But no stress tears or worries.
customer_reviews.author: Kait

customer_reviews.title: Could be great except one thing...
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this bag except one thing...the little clasp thing does NOT stay when you cinch it closed with all your gear in it. You have to then tie a knot, which I'm not very good at =/ I have a dive buddy with the same bag who has the exact same bag, so I know it isn't just a fluke...
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Bowser

customer_reviews.title: Best snorkel/dive gear pack ever!
customer_reviews.text: Far exceeded my expectations! This pack carries a heavy load with ease and leaves your hands free for everything else. It easily holds 2 sets of large fins, masks, snorkels, wet suits, booties, towels, and anything else you can think of with plenty of room to spare. I actually think it could handle 3 of everything. The vertical side zipper makes for easy access to stuff on the bottom. Brilliantly thought out and great build. You cannot beat this pack at any price.
customer_reviews.author: bob g

customer_reviews.title: It is Big!
customer_reviews.text: This back pack is amazing, certainly better than the cheap bags my work gives me to use, and it lets me carry everything into work that I need. It is big though, It's essentially a full size duffel bag, with backpack straps.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Huge bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great Bag! It's a LOT bigger than expected.....I guess I didn't read the dimensions when I bought two of these. I haven't loaded it yet, for our trip, but it looks like one bag will hold set full sets of gear - it's that big! And I also think the handles and back pack straps are worth mentioning. You cn carry the bag or throw it over your shoulder. This is a cool buy!
customer_reviews.author: TeamBOAH

customer_reviews.title: Good quality bag for snorkeling.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! We stashed our snorkeling stuff in it while we were on our cruise. Bag is roomy enough for his & hers mask, fins and snorkel plus room for towels and flip-flops.
customer_reviews.author: Denfire621

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gear bag
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a backpack style bag for my diving gear and this definitely fit the bill. It is well constructed and it seems that I will have many years of use out of it. The shipment arrived on time and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Rooster

customer_reviews.title: XXXXL bag
customer_reviews.text: Extra extra large bag, maybe too big. Able to get a Large BCD, Long Fins, Mask, Snorkel, Booties, Dive Suit, Regulators, and Dive computer in this bag and still have lots of room left. Draw string closure is a little cheap, just tie a quick release knot to keep it closed and you will have no problems. Comfortable to wear with all my gear in side. Shipping was extremely fast.
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: If you like top loading mesh bags this bag is well made. However, the zipper on the side is too short to really use it horizontally. I returned it and bought the Akona Stealth bag...so far I like it much better.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: HUGE and perfect for two people
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what my husband and I were looking for. We needed a bag that would fit both our fins, snorkels, masks, and misc gear for scuba diving. This works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Each bag fit a BCD, Regulator, Fins, Mask, Snorkel, Dive watch, go pro and dive book. Plus, I kept my cell phone and sunscreen in the outside pocket. It's hard to carry with a sunburn but otherwise fits just like a backpack but there is also a handle on the side for a duffle bag style carry.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: The bag is big enough to throw all your gear including fin, bcd, boot, towel. The front pocket is big enough to put two dive mask. The meash material is thick and durable (different with other model which thin mesh). I like there is a zip on the side, make reach things inside is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Buy this bag! no disappointments!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for a trip to the Keys. After reading great reviews I was sold. My package arrived quickly with plenty of time before my departure. This bag is gnar!!!! I could fit booties, fins, snorkel, 5mil wetsuit, bcd, regulator, log book, mask, and even lobster bag AND had room for a towel! This bag is the bees knees and straps to the back like a bookbag. My fellow divers who went on the trip with me were envious of this perfect dive bag. I would recommend this bag to any diver. Far better than ones I've seen at dive shops in Maryland AND in the Keys!
customer_reviews.author: chuck norris

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: Great for carrying a set of snorkeling gear, towel and beach needs from car to beach. I have several different similar items, this is excellently made and has held up very well. This is bigger than most, I carry big heavy Apollo fins and flotation vest. You could probable get 2 sets of snorkel gear or a BCand scuba regs. in it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Belken

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality - Plenty Big
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical of this bag and did not expect too much from it because of the low price. To my delight, this bag exceeds all of my expectations. Not only was it cheap but it is great quality and very large. I used it the other day and had my mask, fins, boots, snorkel, BCD, regulator w/ bag, and a shorty wetsuit all in this thing with ease. There was room to spare which is saying a lot considering I wear a size 14 boot and 2X BCD and wetsuit. Nothing about this bag feels cheap and I would not hesitate to buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: Good bag plenty or room worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I like the bag it’s roomy and all of the features the mesh and fabric seem tough I don’t like the rope on the top opening when I have all of my equipment in the bag and pick it up by the shoulder straps, the top pulls open not a big deal just kinda annoying the fin part I’m guessing it’s not wide enough for my fins but not a big deal all in all I like the bag
customer_reviews.author: Austin Lee Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Large and roomy bag
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've used it one one boat trip. Large bag. Fits all my gear and still has room for additional stuff. I like the large pocket on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, strong, good storage
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag. Full Side zipper gives more access than just the top adjustable cord. The backpack straps are cushy and strong. The inside pocket is massive as is the outer storage. This bag is perfect for SCUBA & snorkel gear.
customer_reviews.author: Jinjer

customer_reviews.title: Great, Affordable Bag
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag. I've only used it on twice so far (other than storing some gear in it when I'm not diving), but I'm very impressed. The quality of construction seems excellent. The outside bag is a nice size to hold a number of smallish items. It easily accommodates a BCD, full wetsuit, regulators and bag, mask, fins and snorkel, with room for more. Top load and side load through zipper make it easy, and the shoulder straps are padded and comfortable. Solid carry handles, too. I bought two, one for me and one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando customer

customer_reviews.title: This bag is excellent and lasts a long time
customer_reviews.text: This bag is excellent and lasts a long time. This is my second bag, and I use it for all of my swimming gear and scuba gear. I had my first bag for over 10 years, and it held up well, but the toggle needed to be replaced. I gave it as a gift to one of my swimming buddies, and he bought a new toggle for it, and loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: Tony R

customer_reviews.title: It is comfortable to transport
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it on a dive yet, but this bag holds all my gear (except weights). It is comfortable to transport, either with the carrying handle or with the shoulder straps. The extra compartment on the outside of the bag is roomy enough for a reg, but I put lights, and dry case, and a few other small items there. Looking forward to trying it on an upcoming dive trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack for diving gear
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack for our diving gear! Everything that we needs fits (except for BCD) inside this bag and has sturdy strap to carry it around.
customer_reviews.author: chong

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Fits all my scuba gear! My BCD, regulator, fins and shoes, mask and snorkel, and wetsuit. side pocket is perfect for your dive log book, anti fog solution. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: =jammaster=

customer_reviews.title: Perfecto!
customer_reviews.text: OMG this thing is good. Took two sets of personal gear(mask/fins/snorkel/fins/wetsuits) and had room to spare. Everyone else on the dive boat that didn't have similar bags were getting whatever duffel they brought soaked. Seems built to withstand a small nuclear event as well. Also, like that I can wear it like a backpack, it gets heavy and carrying it as a one handed duffel could get tough.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Woodwell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bag that served its purpose while we were on ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bag that served its purpose while we were on a vacation that involved a lot of snorkel gear-hauling. The bag is very big (a good thing) but can be a bit cumbersome when loaded with gear. I gave it 4 stars because it does not cinch tightly when closed, making it unbalanced and challenging to carry. Furthermore, the carrying strap are not padded.
customer_reviews.author: MWM

customer_reviews.title: It is a good choice...
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement for my Mares Cruise Elite which lasted a few long hauls. This Deluxe bag is so much better than the Elite. The Deluxe has a stronger mesh material that has a rubber type feel to it. Over all, the construction of the Deluxe is leaps and bounds better than the Elite. So if you plan on traveling much, and prefer a backpack style, then I'd consider this.
customer_reviews.author: punk0mi

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag! Big enough for equipment and easy to carry. Several zippers for access and open draw string. Makes diving more organized and much easier to manuver.
customer_reviews.author: Eryn S.

customer_reviews.title: I had another dive bag, but with picking up ...
customer_reviews.text: I had another dive bag, but with picking up my own regulator and BCD, knew I needed a bigger one. The Mares Cruise Deluxe fit my needs, especially how beefy the mesh is. Used it on a boat dive for the first time, and it met most of my expectations. The big external cargo pocket is a definite plus to hold the smaller and more sensitive items. Looking forward to many more dives with my Mares Cruise Deluxe!
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Folds up nicely for travel
customer_reviews.text: It's huge. I bought it to carry two pairs of fins, masks and snorkels, spear, and shorties. I can do that no problem. I ended up only carrying one set as my wife did not dive that trip. It was WAY oversized. Now, if I had a BCD and octopus, if would have been just right. Folds up nicely for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Leedy

customer_reviews.title: It's lightweight easy to wear and also very spacious to store your ...
customer_reviews.text: This Mares Cruise bag is beyond what you would expect for a dive bag. It's lightweight easy to wear and also very spacious to store your gear for upcoming dive trips. I have taken the bag diving 10+ times since purchasing it and have not had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: Great dive bag
customer_reviews.text: Sturdily built and handy to carry with a couple of zip pockets to keep important stuff.
customer_reviews.author: S. Langley

customer_reviews.title: Fits alot of Dive Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Great Big Bag for all my scuba gear. Shorty wetsuit, fins, bcd, octopus, dive sox and hat fit into this bag without any issue! Side pocket is handy, slightly waterproof (it has a hole at the bottom if water gets in it). The shoulder straps are handy or you can use it as a duffle, you choose! It's a win/win while lugging your dive stuff around.
customer_reviews.author: tmkrnlp

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty bag. Very durable so far. It should hold everything you’ll need for a dive. You’ll probably save $20 by buying from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Burt VanBuren

customer_reviews.title: This bag rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I've seen a lot folks asking about the size of this bag and how much equipment it will hold. I bought this bag for my family's snorkel and beach equipment. I can tell you that the bag is incredibly sturdy and holds 2 sets of adult snorkel set and 2 sets of kids snorkel equipment with plenty of room to spare. I am very pleased with this bag!
customer_reviews.author: geektown

customer_reviews.title: Nicest dive bag I've seen
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit surprised at the large size but once I packed it will full size fins, mash, snorkel and all the other gear it is just right. The outside pocket is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: TBW

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy duty bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is amazing. We use it for taking towels and clothes and stuff to the pool, water parks, and we used it during excursions on a cruise with the family. Heavy duty and quality build for sure. Holds so much stuff! The worst thing about the bag is it holds so much stuff, and being the Dad, I end up having to carry it all! Comfortable straps work good though.
customer_reviews.author: Jasonandkristy

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, decent orive
customer_reviews.text: I got this for going to and from the car to dive sites, boats, etc. I usually store everything in a large Tupperware but it wasn't practical to lug that around. This has space for my bp/w, fins, regs, etc. although there is ample room I would have preferred just a bit more but my selection is not the bags fault.
customer_reviews.author: chris s

customer_reviews.title: Great bag! No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for the price. I like that is has a separate space for your regulator or dive log book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: Good value. Pretty durable. Holds all my gear excepts weights. Could use a better closure for top. Tends to loosen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Relief I bought it for snorkeling trip
customer_reviews.text: I received a free mesh bag when I bought my snorkeling equipment. So pleased I read the reviews and saw the light before heading off on my trip. The mesh bag is limited and would have cut into my hands. Was able to pack quite a bit and throw over my shoulder, etc. Used the waterproof sleeve for towel and sundress. Perfect purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly super sized!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! I was worried it wouldn't be large enough but it is huge and definitely large enough to fit large sized fins and a BC as well as all he usual gear. The front pocket is great for storing mask and a bunch of other stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag that easily holds all my gear
customer_reviews.text: Great Bag that easily holds all my gear. The shoulder straps are comfortable and easily adjustable. I would give it 5 stars but the draw string closure at the top comes loose when you pick up the bag because the friction stop on the sting is too flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, rugged and spacious bag
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, rugged and spacious bag! Perfect for my dive gear. I can fit my Scubapro Pro-Tek back BCD, fins, mask, regulator and hoses, weights, knife, GoPro and my 5mm full wetsuit easily. Best purchase I have made as far as dive bags go.
customer_reviews.author: Kory Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great Dive Bag
customer_reviews.text: This backpack holds everything and then some! We use it for all of our snorkel gear (two people), towels, and whatever else we need for the day! It is heavy-duty, has two straps so it can be used as a backpack. Many other bags have just one shoulder strap. Although we don't dive, it would easily hold one person's dive equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Georgiann Weaver

customer_reviews.title: awesome dive bag
customer_reviews.text: it is big enough to hold all of my dive gear, and strong enough to put the weights at the bottom. theres a regulator pocket. it's easy to carry as the backpack straps are solid. the drawstring closes the top so nothing will fall out. I've only used it a few times, but the mesh is coated in rubber or plastic and seems like it will last for quite awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Rufus2269

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Tons of space with a zipper down the side to make access easier. Much bigger than both the mesh bags I have had in the past. Uprights are better for carrying to your dive sight on land, or transporting to a vehicle. I think it is well worth the money. Time will tell on durability.
customer_reviews.author: Sea View

customer_reviews.title: Decent bag.
customer_reviews.text: Bag works great and holds a ton of gear! The only thing is the drawstring will come loose on it's own at times as the piece that secures the string doesn't seem to keep it locked down well enough. But a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Snorky

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dive or snorkel gear
customer_reviews.text: I could not have designed this bag any better if I had designed it myself. Today's trend in dive fins is extra long with a split. These are not the easiest thing to haul on and off the dive boats but they fit perfectly in the Mares bag. There is lots of room for your additional gear with a separate outside pouch for my dry gear. Once the bag is loaded, I can easily sling it on my back with the backpack straps and have my hands free for yet more gear. After the dive, the entire bag can be dunked into fresh water and left to dry for the next adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Iris Marie

customer_reviews.title: Everything fits
customer_reviews.text: This fit all of the gear i own perfectly, down to the fins that fit a size 14 foot. I don't own a bcd or regs but judging from the room left over in the bag it would absolutely fit those two things. I just hope i can take this as a carry on the next time i fly, it seems kind of big.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good gear bag
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased. Used on 6 dives. Plenty of room for storage. Great for wet gear. Nice that it has shoulder straps.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bag is well made, and the straps fit nicely. You can't beat the price for a simple gear bag. The regulator pouch is plenty big enough for your reg and other small bits. There is plenty of room for all your gear (and even some extra!). It's got heavy duty straps and zippers, and the mesh is coated. Seriously, why haven't you clicked on 'add to cart' yet?
customer_reviews.author: KATHY

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my first dive trip. Worked great, way to carry everything I needed. Also very easy to get gear in and out. Only bad thing I could say about is the cinch come loose other than that it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Bagwell

customer_reviews.title: Good multi purpose bag.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent multi-purpose scuba bag. It holds all my gear. I keep my BCD, fins, mask, booties and snorkel in this bag. Still has plenty of room for other stuff. The outside pocket also holds quite a bit as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: Great dive bag!
customer_reviews.text: Roomy enough for all my gear including wet suit and towel. Well built, only used it for a week but it took the pressure well. Comfortable shoulder straps too. I like the mesh, your gear doesn't get stinky too fast.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy S.

customer_reviews.title: and it's easy to keep clean
customer_reviews.text: Holds all of my gear, and it's easy to keep clean. Front pocket is large enough to store goggles in (unless the case you store the goggles in are large), or other equipment. Handy zipper on side allows quick access to gear. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: MadROMAD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mesh backpack!
customer_reviews.text: Very durable coated mesh. Heavy duty hardware. This will last many years. Very nice mesh backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag for all my scuba needs
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag for all my scuba needs! This bag accommodates all my gear sans the nitrox tanks of course! I am rather petite, so I love the fact that I can wear this as a bookbag using the shoulder straps. This bag has two separate compartments that are great for personal items and masks and snorkels.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: Lots of room and large pocket for mask and accessories. Heavy Duty. Diver friends ordering this bag after seeing mine.
customer_reviews.author: Giarc

customer_reviews.title: Great Scuba Gear bag
customer_reviews.text: We own several of these bags, which are well made and more useful than a typical mesh bag. The rubber-coated mesh stands up to saltwater very well and the multiple carry handles supplement the backpack straps for shuttling short distances or on/off a boat. The bag easily accommodates my BC, mask, fins, rolled wetsuit, spools, reel, smb and my save-a-dive kit. Adding a second set of mask, fins and a wet suit will pretty much max out the bag but is doable.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer C

customer_reviews.title: It is large.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I fit all of our gear including her wetsuit and my full face mask and had plenty of room to spare seems like it will last..
customer_reviews.author: Robert mcgarvey

customer_reviews.title: I love these backpacks
customer_reviews.text: I love these backpacks! Very big for hauling all your scuba gear. Get one. You won't regret it. My only complaint is the push button on the strings is not strong enough to keep the top completely closed.
customer_reviews.author: PK

product_meta.title: Mares Cruise Backpack Mesh Deluxe Bag, Black
product_meta.description: Adjustable shoulder and sternum straps for a better fit when used as backpack. Two rubber handles allow you to easily and comfortably carry it when used as bag. The special design protects you from wet equipment. A lateral and sturdy zipper ensures easy access to your equipment at all times, even when the bag is completely overloaded. Wide internal and external pockets to store equipment and more.
feature_bullets: The ultimate travel bag for divers, Durable construction for travel
The perfect gear bag for shore dives or boat dives, Drawstring top and full lateral zipper for easy access
Mesh allows for water drainage after diving, PVC body allows you to stay dry while carrying the bag with wet gear
Outer pocket is great for regulator and computer storage, Padded shoulder straps for easy carrying
Padded grab handles for quick transportation, Anti-skid base

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
